definition: A liquid intended for human consumption.
notes: Includes a wide range of drinkable products, both alcoholic and non-alcoholic.

definition: A hot drink made by infusing the dried, crushed leaves of the tea plant in boiling water.
notes: Commonly served hot but can also be enjoyed cold.

definition: A type of tea that is made from Camellia sinensis leaves and buds that have not undergone the same withering and oxidation process used to make oolong teas and black teas.
notes: Green tea is known for its health benefits.

definition: A type of small, informal food product, often salty or sweet, meant for snacking.
notes: Examples includes chips, nuts, crackers and cookies.

definition: A brewed drink prepared from roasted coffee beans, the seeds of berries from certain Coffea species.
notes: Widely consumed around the world, commonly served hot.

definition: A drink made from the infusion or decoction of herbs, spices, or other plant material in hot water.
An alcoholic drink made from yeast-fermented malt flavored with hops.
notes: One of the oldest and most widely consumed alcoholic drinks in the world.

definition: An alcoholic drink made by fermenting grapes with various yeast strains.
notes: Types vary greatly depending on the fermentation process and the grapes used.

definition: A liquid that is naturally contained in fruit and vegetables; often consumed as a beverage.
notes: Available as fresh juice or processed juice.

definition: A broad category of food items that are rich in sugar and carbohydrates. Generally considered to be a treat or dessert.
notes: Includes items such as chocolates, candies, and other sweet baked goods.
